tweets.text:
Heavy rainfall across England may cause rivers to overflow. Keep your distance and stay safe. 

If you need to go out, check your local #flood risk first: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY  

#PrepareActSurvive #StormChristoph https://t.co/NUld5Ux9c9

There are a significant number of #flood warnings across England due to heavy rain.  

Watch our video to know what to do in a flood and sign up for flood warnings in your area now: https://t.co/MPz7FwsWeY 

#PrepareActSurvive https://t.co/ILEujXjdR9

#StormChristoph has brought lots of wind and rain to #Lancashire over the last couple of days. In some areas, flood water remains on roads and pathways.

Follow the latest advice from the @EnvAgency and avoid driving through flood water üöó #StaySafe https://t.co/PPwcxhxFj2

domain.name: Ongoing News Story
domain.description: Ongoing News Stories like 'Brexit'

tweets.text:
We are already making preparations ahead of the heavy #rain due this week. 

Team are out across the North West making sure rivers are running clear and free from debris. 

Sign up now to receive free flood alerts and warnings ‚ñ∂Ô∏è  https://t.co/uGQ4g6A5Xn https://t.co/oAgHMr9KrN

urls.title: Flood Alerts in England and Wales

tweets.text:
Emu‚Äôs real time #floodalert platform is flagging a large number of key services across various regions in England and Wales that are at risk of #flooding. Stay safe!

Here is a link to our interactive map if you would like to find out more: https://t.co/N5bNIf4JHR https://t.co/LuNVV3NXk1

A number of flood warnings and flood alerts are currently in place across west Cheshire. Please take care and only travel if your journey is essential. Follow @EnvAgencyNW for updates. https://t.co/fuRIXKZb9W

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK

tweets.text:
Flood warnings are in force across #Yorkshire and river levels remain very high. Keep away from swollen rivers.

If you need to go out, check your local #flood risk first: https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb

#floodaware https://t.co/D0VxKZbwA5

‚ÑπÔ∏è The @EnvAgencyNW have reduced the Severe Weather Warning currently in place with a Flood Warning covering parts of Didsbury, Chorlton & Northenden. 

Agencies & the council can confirm that people evacuated from their homes can now return safely. 

1/6 https://t.co/SpTTLKA6Cn

tweets.text:
Never seen it as bad as this ... Parkgate Rd & Deva Link closed off and under water ... Finchett's Gutter, the Highfield Drain & the flood lagoon are all overflowing. Two cars abandoned and at least one house under water.
@EnvAgencyNW @cheshirepolice @Go_CheshireWest https://t.co/rJGT2AOLUN

Our field teams are out and about across the region responding to reports of flooding and blockages. Here you can see the before/after images from Clipstone Brook in Bedfordshire, which was blocked with debris as water levels were rising.
#TeamEA #FloodAware https://t.co/qtVWtGyL6i

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has removed #FloodWarnings in our area on the River Wye at #LittonMill. Standing water & debris may still remain.

See #flood guidance & emergency contact info
üëâ https://t.co/SHUb8P1Yqc https://t.co/QWr8lFZGqE

My thoughts are with those who've sadly already been affected by #StormChristoph and the flooding this week.

Each flooded home and business is a personal tragedy, and the @EnvAgency will keep working for as long as it takes to help those communities recover.

Thank you for all your work keeping us safe, whatever the weather @manchesterfire @gmpolice @ManCityCouncil @EnvAgency üôè

#StrongerTogether üíõ https://t.co/Iw9x8X8zF6

A big thank you to our teams from @gmpolice, @manchesterfire, @ManCityCouncil & @EnvAgency who worked through the night to keep people safe.

Well done to the local community for supporting them. üëèüëè

It was a close run thing & the danger‚Äôs not yet averted. Please stay vigilant. https://t.co/Rk1BipTQiL

Sandbags have run out at Shrewsbury council depot. No connection I‚Äôm sure with broken algorithm and consequent flood alert phone calls made in error last night at 1am from @EnvAgency causing sleepless nights all over Shrewsbury. @ShropshireStar @JoanneWrittleTV @jimallthetime

urls.title: Water rescue teams called out as Storm Christoph floods hit Herefordshire
urls.description: Water rescue teams have been called out overnight as river levels continue to rise in Herefordshire.

tweets.text:
#StormChristoph | The river Wye at the Old Bridge in Hereford is currently at 5.15 metres ‚Äì and rising.

@EnvAgency has issued a flood warning for the area and says the predicted peak will be up to 5.3m this evening.

Live updates
üëâhttps://t.co/Lif7SIyJNR

urls.title: Flooding - updates
urls.description: The Amber weather warning across the whole of the county means communities across the Derbyshire Dales need to be on flood alert over the coming days. Particular areas of concern highlighted by the Environment Agency are Bakewell, Baslow and Matlock. As always, the big message is BE PREPARED - see the advice on our website.

tweets.text:
The @EnvAgency has removed #FloodWarning in our area on the Rivers Wye & Derwent at #Rowsley. Photo is of our teams tackling floods there in early hours.

Now 7 remaining #FloodWarnings in Dales.

üëâ https://t.co/SHUb8P1Yqc https://t.co/IwbXNwikGk

urls.title: Flood warnings for England - GOV.UK
urls.description: Check your risk of flooding: get current flood warnings, river and sea levels, check the 5-day forecast or use flood risk maps

tweets.text: River levels remain high as they continue to rise due to rainfall and snow melt. There are currently 43 food warnings out across Yorkshire. Stay #floodaware and sign up for flood warnings in your area https://t.co/OVBXgMyngb https://t.co/B2Pjo9xR3L

urls.title: Flooding - Lancashire County Council
urls.description: If there is an immediate risk to your life or you are trapped by flood water call 999.

tweets.text: On Monday we lifted the bridge from the top of the #Foss Barrier as part of our preparations to replace the Foss barrier gate. Due to high river levels, we've delayed the rest of the work until river levels have fallen. @CityofYork https://t.co/FUlGqSOym6

Well,  that would have been a very different story.  @EnvAgencyNW did one hell of a job balancing the water to stop it breaching. Them and @gmpolice did a fantastic job last night.  #Didsbury #didsburyflood https://t.co/j4IRjlc3jQ
